result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobby D Conners Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>10-50g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Must not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA and follow through. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

records.addlTxt: 10-05-16  Sentencing hearing
Per RASO - defendant has been transferred to the prison system

Court Reporter: Jennifer Schmaling.  Defendant Bobby D Conners in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Bobby D Conners in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

State had one addition to PSI regarding prior criminal record.  No objection by defense, to be added.  No Chapter 950 requirement.
Defense had no additions or corrections to PSI.

State requests 12 years (8 IC & 4 ES) on ct 4; and on other 3 counts, 8 years (4 + 4) imposed and stayed for probation consecutive to ct 4, those to be 2 concurrent and 1 consecutive.
Defense requests probation and an imposed and stayed sentence of 8 years (4 + 4) on each count, concurrent.

BTC:  on count 4:  WSP 9 years (6 IC & 3 ES)
Conditions:  no alcohol or c/s unless prescribed by a physician, random UA''s & breathalyzers
AODA  assmt, treatment & aftercare and any other counseling deemed appropriate by agent
full time employment

cts 1, 2 & 3:  EACH withheld sentence, 3 years probation
same conditions, concurrent to one another but consecutive to count 4

CIP and SAT eligible
DNA sample
firearms/voting warnings given
costs including DNA assmt.
CFTS  - may bring back to count if disagreement with amount.

Cts. 1-4:  GUILTY
Sentencing hearing on October 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bobby D Conners in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Bobby D Conners in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.

DAY ONE:
State has provided updated consideration list to defense.  Defense acknowledges receipt.
Jury enters courtroom.
Oath #2 given.
Preliminary Instructions given.
Opening Statements.
State calls L.M., DSAT.
State calls Investigator M. Kwapil, DSAT.
State calls Investigator M. Sorensen, DSAT.
State calls Investigator H. Freidel, DSAT.
State calls Investigator K. Kupper, DSAT.
State calls State Crime Lab Analyst M. McMahon, DSAT.
State moves to admit Ex's 1-26.  Defense has no objection.  BTC:  Rec'd.
State rests.
Defense moves for directed verdict.
State objects.
BTC:  Motion denied.
Court conducts colloquy with defendant re: right to testify.
BTC:  Finding that defendant freely, voluntarily and knowingly asserts his right to testify.
Defense calls Bobby Conners Jr., DSAT.
Defense rests.
State recalls Investigator H. Freidel, still under oath.
State recalls Investigator K. Kupper, still under oath.
State rests.
Jury Instruction conference outside presence of jury.
Closing arguments.
Jury Instructions read to jury.
Alternate juror selected and excused.
Oath #3 given.
Jurors to deliberate 4:07 pm.
Defense moves to dismiss, nunc pro tunc.
BTC:  Motion denied.
Jurors return with verdict

VERDICT:
Ct. 1, Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), Second or Subsequent:  GUILTY.
Ct. 2, Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), Second or Subsequent:  GUILTY.
Ct. 3, Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), Second or Subsequent:  GUILTY.
Ct. 4, Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>10-50g), Second or Subsequent:  GUILTY.

Jurors polled and excused.
State moves for judgment on verdict.
Defense moves for judgment notwithstanding the verdict.
BTC:  Judgment on verdict is granted.  PSI ordered.  Atty Kuehn is not to share any juror information with defendant.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bobby D Conners in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Bobby D Conners in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee. Preliminary hearing at 12-10-2015 09:00 am

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Bobby D Conners in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Bobby D Conners in custody.  MacKenzie R. Bishop-Buchanan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.
